com.tigertext.ttandroid.sse

Class SSEBatchHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tigertext.ttandroid.sse.SSEBatchHelper

  • public class SSEBatchHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by carydobeck on 8/8/17. This class is intended to wrap all the batching logic into one easy to follow place, making sure that all work is held until the batch finishes. Batching should save the data to disk first, and then can ack events and publish any updates after Currently can batch: DB transactions event ids to ack unread counts for organizations pub subs IMPORTANT: NOT thread safe, all calls must be on the same thread due to DB transaction policy

      • flushBatch

        public void flushBatch()
        Notify the batch that it should save the current changes and finish. This batch helper can then be reused for future batches.

      • yieldAndFlushIfContended

        public boolean yieldAndFlushIfContended(long sleepAfterYieldDelay)
        Yield if there are any other threads asking to use the database
        Parameters:
        sleepAfterYieldDelay - a positive long in millis to yield for other transactions, or 0 if douldn't wait extra time
        Returns:
        True if the transaction was yielded and a new transaction started, false if database didn't yield

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        True if there is nothing currently batched, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        to finish the batch and empty the state
